spanish: Mi hijo cumplirá seis años el próximo mes.
Mi hijo cumplirá seis años el mes que viene.
english: My son will be six years old next month.

spanish: La Sra. White nos da una prueba todos los días.
english: Ms. White gives us a test every day.

spanish: ¿Cómo se dice libro en chino?
english: How do you say book in Chinese?

spanish: Cada una de las lecciones es importante.
english: Each of the lessons is important.

spanish: Querían estar solos durante una hora.
english: They wanted to be by themselves for an hour.

spanish: Apoyo la libertad de expresión.
english: I support freedom of expression.

spanish: Se me cayó el teléfono mientras jugaba al tenis.
english: I dropped my phone while I was playing tennis.

spanish: La tormenta ha retrasado su vuelo.
english: The storm has delayed their flight.
The storm has delayed your flight.

spanish: Estuvimos acampando unos días, pero ya estamos en casa.
english: We were camping for a few days, but we are home now.

spanish: Hemos estado acampando durante unos días, pero ya estamos en casa.
english: We've been camping for a few days, but we're home now.

spanish: ¿Cómo van las clases?
english: How are the classes going?

spanish: ¿Como estas?
english: How are you doing?
How are you?
How do you do?

spanish: ¿Cómo va todo?
¿Cómo va?
¿Cómo te va?
english: How is it going?
How's it going?

spanish: No hablo mucho, mis compañeros hablan más que yo.
No digo mucho, mis compañeros de trabajo hablan más que yo.
english: I don't say much, my coworkers talk more than I do.
I don't say much, my coworkers talk more than me.

spanish: Fue a su escritorio a buscar una engrapadora.
Fue a su escritorio a buscar una grapadora.
english: She went to her desk to get a stapler.
He went to his desk to get a stapler.

spanish: Hizo algunas preguntas difíciles, pero yo estaba preparado.
english: He asked some hard questions, but I was prepared.
He asked some tough questions, but I was prepared.

spanish: ¿La Sra. White nos dio tarea?
english: Did Ms. White give us homework?
Did Mrs. White give us homework?

spanish: Conduzco al trabajo todos los días.
english: I drive to work every day.

spanish: Juan ya me ha mostrado los alrededores.
english: John has already shown me around.

spanish: José tiene muchas ganas de ir a nadar a la playa.
english: Jose really wants to go for a swim at the beach.
Jose really wants to go swimming at the beach.

spanish: ¿Qué hay de comprar unas pizzas?
english: What about getting some pizzas?
What about buying some pizzas?

spanish: ¿Qué hay de comprar unas pizzas?
english: What about getting some pizzas?
What about buying some pizzas?

spanish: Ellas retrasaron el juego porque estaba lloviendo.
english: They delayed the game because it was raining.

spanish: Cuando me enteré, ya era demasiado tarde.
english: By the time I found out, it was too late.

spanish: Tenemos que entregar el formulario.
english: We have to hand in the form.

spanish: No puedo recoger a Anne hoy. ¿Puedes recogerla?
english: I can't pick up Anne today. Can you pick her up?

spanish: La profesora va a repartir los exámenes.
english: The teacher is going to hand out the exams.

spanish: ¿Podrías recoger a Michael?
english: Could you pick up Michael?

spanish: Pregúntale a tu hermano quién es ese jugador alto.
english: Ask your brother who that tall player is.

spanish: Si le roban su tarjeta de crédito, cancélela de inmediato.
english: If your credit card gets stolen, cancel it right away.

spanish: La carrera es de cien metros, que son más de 300 pies.
english: The race is one hundred meters, which is over 300 feet.

spanish: La piscina tiene cien metros, que son más de 300 pies.
english: The pool is one hundred meters, which is over 300 feet.

spanish: ¿Con qué frecuencia usa Arthur las redes sociales?
english: How often does Arthur use social media?

spanish: Necesito conectarme y revisar mi correo electrónico.
english: I need to go online and check my email.

spanish: Los enemigos estaban escondidos por toda la montaña.
english: The enemies were hidden all over the mountain.

spanish: ¿Te importaría cerrar la puerta?
english: Would you mind shutting the door?

spanish: La calefacción no funciona en mi apartamento.
english: The heat is not working in my apartment.

spanish: La calefacción se apagará sola.
english: The heating will turn off by itself.

spanish: Ben da una clase sobre cómo maquillarse.
english: Ben teaches a class on how to put on makeup.
Ben teaches a class about how to put on makeup.

spanish: ¿Qué gasolinera tiene los baños más limpios?
english: Which gas station has the cleanest restrooms?

spanish: El basurero está hecho de plástico.
english: The garbage can is made of plastic.

spanish: Mi esposo se mudará el próximo mes.
english: My husband will be moving next month.

spanish: ¿Saliste en año nuevo?
english: Did you go out on New Year's Day?

spanish: ¿Puedes por favor vestirte?
english: Can you please get dressed?

spanish: ¿Quien va a pagarlo?
english: Who is going to pay for it?

spanish: Dejamos la computadora portátil en el estante como de costumbre.
english: We left the laptop on the shelf as usual.

spanish: ¿Podemos ir a la tienda, por favor?
english: Can we go to the store, please?
Can we please go to the store?

spanish: Es hora de vestirse para la escuela.
english: It's time to get dressed for school.

spanish: Enviarán el cheque por correo.
english: They are sending the check by mail.

spanish: Vive en una casa grande.
english: He lives in a big house.

spanish: Te veo en el parque.
english: See you at/in the park.
phrases.detail: Both 'in the park' and 'at the park' are grammatically correct. However, they mean two different things. 'At the park’ means the person is at the area of the park. While 'in the park’ means more than the person is enclosed within the park.

spanish: El gobierno ha agregado un impuesto a los cigarrillos.
english: The government has added a tax on cigarettes.

spanish: ¿En qué calle está la zapatería?
english: What street is the shoe store on?

spanish: ¿A qué hora llega el avión?
english: What time does the plane arrive?

spanish: A qué sabe esto?
english: What does it taste like?

spanish: ¿A quién apoya tu hermano?
english: Who is your brother rooting for?

spanish: Marco me pisó el dedo del pie y fue muy doloroso.
english: Marco stepped on my toe and it was very painful.

spanish: ¿Cómo va el nuevo trabajo?
english: How is the new job going?

spanish: Hago mis operaciones bancarias en línea.
Hago mis operaciones bancarias por Internet.
english: I do my banking online.

spanish: Nosotros hacemos karaoke todos los sábados.
english: We do karaoke every Saturday.

spanish: Nosotros hacemos karaoke todos los sábados.
english: We do karaoke every Saturday.

spanish: Todos los restaurantes están cerrados.
english: All of the restaurants are closed.

spanish: ¿Puedo caminar a la librería desde aquí?
english: Can I walk to the bookstore from here?

spanish: Pregúntale a tu padre.
english: Ask your father.

spanish: ¿Qué restaurante está más cerca?
english: Which restaurant is closer?

spanish: Nosotras hicimos brunch en pascua.
english: We made brunch on easter.

spanish: Quiero escribir tan bien como John.
english: I want to write as well as John.
